description: '''Caipira''' is a musical style of the [[Caipira culture]], which originated in [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], during the period of [[State of Brazil|Portuguese colonization]]. The theme of the Caipira style, performed mainly to the accompaniment of a [[Caipira viola|Caipira guitar]], is especially based on life in the [[Rural area|countryside]] or [[Backcountry|''sertão'']], where Caipira culture first developed. The first Caipira music group emerged in 1924, the ''Turma Caipira'', created by the folklorist [[Cornélio Pires]], being composed in its first phase by Arlindo Santana, Sebastião Ortiz de Camargo, Zico Dias, Ferrinho, Mariano da Silva, Caçula and [[Mandi & Sorocabinha|Olegário José de Godoy]], all from [[Piracicaba]].
